00009 // ID factory for generating unique id numbers.

00015 #include <cassert>

00017 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00018 // Function: IDFactory()
00019 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00020 IDFactory::IDFactory() : m_freeIDs(), m_nextID(0)
00021 {
00022 }
00023 
00024 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00025 // Function: ~IDFactory()
00026 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 IDFactory::~IDFactory()
00028 {
00029     m_freeIDs.clear();
00030 }
00031 
00032 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00033 // Function: getID()
00034 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 int IDFactory::getID()
00036 {
00037     // Retrieve an id from the list if there are already free IDs.
00038     if (!m_freeIDs.empty())
00039     {
00040         int id = m_freeIDs.front();
00041         m_freeIDs.pop_front();
00042         return id;
00043     }
00044 
00045     // Otherwise use the next available id.
00046     int id = m_nextID;
00047     ++m_nextID;
00048 
00049     return id;
00050 }
00051 
00052 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 // Function: freeID()
00054 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00055 void IDFactory::freeID(int id)
00056 {
00057     // Add the id to the list of free IDs.
00058     m_freeIDs.push_back(id);
00059 }
00060 
00061 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00062 // Function: usedID()
00063 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 void IDFactory::usedID(int id)
00065 {
00066     // There are three cases to handle.
00067     // 1. The given ID would be simply the next ID.
00068     if (id == m_nextID)
00069     {
00070         // Just increment the next ID counter.
00071         ++m_nextID;
00072     }
00073     // 2. The given ID is larger than any of the previous IDs.
00074     else if (id > m_nextID)
00075     {
00076         int oldNext = m_nextID;
00077         m_nextID = id;
00078 
00079         // Add the missing IDs to the list of free IDs.
00080         for (int i = oldNext; i < m_nextID; ++i)
00081         {
00082             m_freeIDs.push_back(i);
00083         }
00084 
00085         ++m_nextID;
00086     }
00087     // 3. The given ID is less than the next ID, and thus, should be in the list of free IDs.
00088     else
00089     {
00090         // Find the corresponding item and remove it from the list.
00091         IDList::iterator found = std::find(m_freeIDs.begin(), m_freeIDs.end(), id);
00092 
00093         if (found != m_freeIDs.end())
00094         {
00095             m_freeIDs.erase(found);
00096         }
00097     }
00098 }
